717363f-a.text:
Broadway, north from 27th Street.  The buildings in the immediate foreground, which constitute the Coleman Houses, will stand in 1936, but will be remodelled past all recognition.  The building on the S.W. corner of 28th Street will also stand in 1936, but six stories will have been added to it, to make it an eleven-story building.  The buildings in the next block will survive with little change, as Proctor's Fifth Avenue Theatre, and later simply the Fifth Avenue Theatre.
1889.
Brown Brothers.

717367f.text:
John L. Sullivan's saloon, 1177 Broadway, west side, between 27th and 28th Streets. Sullivan opened the saloon after losing his title to James J. Corbett and his precedent has been followed by Corbett and Jack Dempsey, to mention only two names. On the first floor fire escape is a life-size billboard of Colonel
William F. Cody,(Buffalo Bill).
About 1893.
International News.

711863f-a.text:
Hotel Beverwyck, 27th Street, north side, between Broadway and Sixth Avenue.
1922.
Gift of E.W. Jenks.

717365f.text:
Broadway, north from 27th Street. The buildings in the left foreground were once the Coleman House, but have now, through remodelling, lost all resemblance to their former state. The building on the S.W. corner of 28th Street was once a five-story building, as is clearly shown by the contrast of the older with the newer part of the building. Proctor's Fifth Avenue Theatre is housed in old buildings which date back at least to the eighties.
1926.
Brown Brothers.

717364f-c.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, from 29th to 27th Streets. In the immediate foreground is the Hotel Breslin. The large white building, in the extreme right background is the Victoria Building, on the site of the Hotel Victoria, which was made famous by the patronage of President Grover Cleveland.
P. L. Sperr  July 3, 1928
(2)
Broadway, east side, from 29th to 31st Streets. In the foreground is the old Gilsey House, built in the early 1870s, converted into an office building between 1910 and 1916, and
still standing in 1936.
P. L. Sperr  June 2, 1928
(3)
Broadway, east side, north from and including 28th Street. In the centre of the picture is the Hotel Breslin, and above it is the famous Gilsey House, now remodeled into an office
buildings.
P. L. Sperr  June 2, 1928

717362f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from, but not including, 27th Street.
July 13, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
